problem: Spinner I is divided into four equal sections labeled 97, 11, 2952, 90, 51, 17, 86 and 21. Spinner II is divided into five equal sections labeled 81, 63, 19, 61 and 83. If each spinner is spun and the resulting numbers are multiplied, what is the probability that the product is a four-digit even number? Express your answer as a common fraction.
